raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

Mouse 15H05 was capable of blocking canine IL-31 signaling in both feline and canine cells with the potency in the canine assay being slightly higher.
Conversion of mouse antibodies to feline and canine chimeras had minimal impact on the potency against feline IL-31 in the feline potency assay (IC50 range 1.15-3.45 μg/ml).
Similar results were observed when these chimeras were tested against feline IL-31 signaling on the canine DH82 cell line with a slight increase in potency (IC50=0.71 μg/ml) observed for the 15H05 mouse: canine chimera.
The mouse: feline 15H05 chimera was slightly less potent in this assay format compared to the mouse: canine form (IC50 28.61 vs. 12.49 μg/ml).

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* The mouse: feline chimeric forms of 11 E12 and 15H05 also had comparable IC50 values showing inhibition of feline IL-31 induced pSTAT3 signaling in canine and feline macrophage cells (FIG. 3).
* Following an intravenous dose of 0.5 μg/kg feline IL-31 (SEQ ID NO: 159; Feline_IL-31_E_coli), the corresponding nucleotide sequence for which is (SEQ ID NO: 160; Feline_IL-31_E_coli), cats will portray transient pruritic behavior tha 

Note that only two sentences were found to contain all four required components: a specific molecule name (feline IL-31), a bioactivity metric (IC50 or dose), a specific numeric value (comparable IC50 values or 0.5 μg/kg), and a unit (not explicitly stated for IC50, but implied to be a ratio or concentration, and μg/kg for the dose).

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* The chimeric forms of both mAbs have a comparable KD value to their mouse progenitor with the affinity of mouse: feline 11E12 being slightly superior to both feline and canine IL-31 (FIG. 2, Section A).
* The mouse: feline 15H05 chimera has an approximately 2-fold increased IC50 to that of mouse: feline 11E12 chimera against feline IL-31 induced pSTAT3 signaling in feline FCWF4 cells (FIG. 3).
